message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a generative model for sentence representations that aims to disentangle syntax and semantics. The paper focuses on natural language processing tasks, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. The use of multiple losses and aligned paraphrastic sentences suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. The investigation of the effect of moving from bag-of-words to recurrent neural network modules suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. Finally, the evaluation of the models on semantic and syntactic similarity tasks suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category, which often involves evaluating models on similarity tasks.
